results.title: Know your library. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Frustration of a girl who has not had elementary school library instruction before entering a large library. Close-ups of library equipment. Stresses library as a centre for materials other than books. Librarian offers help in using the card catalogue, finding books and using reference materials.

results.title: Know your library
results.brief_description: From this film, students will learn something of the overall organisation of a typical American high school library - how to use the card catalogue; the principles of the Dewey decimal system; and how to use the encyclopaedia, the Reader’s Guide, and the vertical file.

results.title: Know your friends, know your enemies
results.creator_credit: Crowsfoot Films, Peter Gray and Garry Lane
results.brief_description: The LaTrobe Valley power workers’ strike in 1977 seriously crippled the State of Victoria. This film analyses the causes of the collapse of a just and seemingly invincible strike through a combination of personal accounts and archival footage.

results.title: Know your baby
results.brief_description: An illustration of approved methods of psychological care of the newborn infant. A home situation is shown where other children are present, and the consideration and understanding necessary until the family adjusts itself to the demands of the newcomer are noted. Many aspects of the care of the infant are dealt with, and their psychological implications stressed, including such points as clothing and bedding, the bath, breast feeding and bottle feeding, maintenance of normal home atmosphere, prevention of any feeling of neglect in older children, and the need to develop the interest and participation of brothers and sisters in the care of the new baby.

results.title: Know the Commonwealth. No. 2. New Zealand
results.brief_description: Two islands at the opposite end of the world to Britain are the home of two races - Maori and British. When first discovered, New Zealand was called the land of the Long White Cloud - the first British people arrived in 1830. New Zealanders are very proud of their unity. Also shows the natural hot water springs and various agricultural industries.

results.title: Knot at home project: disc two (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, New South Wales Film and Television Office, BIG hART and Phillip Crawford
results.brief_description: The eight films included in the two Knot at Home titles are the result of a series of community projects run by BIG hART, a non profit community organisation. The projects were designed to give people who often go unheard a chance to tell their stories. From 1998 to 2004 over five hundred young people were asked to tell stories about when they felt “not at home”. The “Knot at Home” films present their stories using interviews, narratives, vignettes, songs, animations, dramatised scenes and memories. The young storytellers have made the films themselves, mentored by experienced filmmakers. Contents of “Knot at Home Disc Two” are: Program Five, “Stories of my Family”; Program Six, “Stories of Loyalty” (short film sequences directed by Nathan Brown and Phillip Crawford); Program Seven, “Stories of Insight”; and Program Eight, “Stories About Telling my Story” (short film sequences directed by Rachel Ward). Disc One [319750].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Film Commission, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, New South Wales Film and Television Office, BIG hART and Phillip Crawford

results.title: Knot at home project: disc one (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, New South Wales Film and Television Office, BIG hART and Phillip Crawford
results.brief_description: The eight films included in the two Knot at Home titles are the result of a series of community projects run by BIG hART, a non profit community organisation. The projects were designed to give people who often go unheard a chance to tell their stories. From 1998 to 2004 over five hundred young people were asked to tell stories about when they felt “not at home”. The “Knot at Home” films present their stories using interviews, narratives, vignettes, songs, animations, dramatised scenes and memories. The young storytellers have made the films themselves, mentored by experienced filmmakers. Contents of “Knot at Home Disc One” are: Program One, “Stories of Survival” (short film sections directed by Sian Davies); Program Two, “Stories of Security” (short film section directed by Brendan Fletcher); Program Three, “Stories of Love”; (dramatised scenes directed by Bek Smith and Matt O’Connell) and Program Four, “Stories of Dreams” (short film sequences directed by Matthew Priestly and Bronwyn Purvis) Disc Two [319751].

results.title: Knockout thrills
results.brief_description: Newsreel footage capturing the closing stages of some historic boxing matches. 1. Gene Tunney versus Georges Capentier (Round 14, 24th of July 1924, Polo Grounds, New York City). 2. Harry Wills versus Paulino Uzcudun (Round 4, 13th of July 1927, Brooklyn, New York City). 3. Jack Dempsey versus Jack Sharkey (Round 6-7, 21st of July 1927, Yankee Stadium, New York City). 4. Joe Louis versus James J. Braddock (Round 7-8, 22nd of June 1937, Chicago).
